Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2008 06:08AM Lili46 wrote: I had 3 nodes removed and also asked my surgeon about precautions and limitations for the future. He told me that there are none. He told me anything that I have done to my good arm I can have done to the arm that I had the nodes taken from.  I was under the impression that there was a slim chance of getting lymphedema in that arm. I certainly want to avoid it if I can. After reading the other posts I think I will be a little more cautious with my arm now.
Posts.Title: 4 nodes removed - lymphedema risk? BustersMom Deedee79

Posts.Content: Nov 20, 2008 07:34AM Lili46 wrote: Hi Jose...I started taking 200 mg of B6 for the tingling in my fingers and feet from my TC treatment during my 3rd treatment. I don't know if it is the B6 or it's in my head but it has worked. My feet and fingers are fine now. L
